metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5068 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of picture ID in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 58.0.3029.96 for Mac, Windows, and Linux allowed a remote attacker to trigger a race condition via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5068` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.96-0ubuntu1.1352').
